commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: One, two, three, four. One, two, three, four...

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: *Sigh* My movements are too slow in the second half. I need to work on my stamina.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Okay, one more time! I can do this!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Ayumu.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Whoa! Sh-Shioriko, you scared me.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: You're still here?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Yes, the live show's coming up, after all.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I am well aware, but you do not want to worsen your condition by overworking yourself.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I observed you for a bit before I said anything. Your footwork was much sloppier than usual. That was not dancing. You were simply moving your feet.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: If you keep practicing like that, you will only develop strange habits. It is pointless to continue.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Shioriko, you do know a lot about school idols, don't you?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: The same as anyone else.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Really? Um, I always tell myself I have to work extra hard for the other members, but then that makes it hard for me to know when to stop practicing.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: For the other members? Ayumu, do you feel guilty that you will be performing instead of them?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Huh? Well, yes, a little.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Then why couldn't you keep your feelings of wanting to do it to yourself?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I don't know. I thought I'd do the best job of showing all those students, young and ready to take on the world, how fun it is to do something for the first time.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Is that why you thought you should be the one on stage?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: You know, I won't be standing up on stage alone, Shioriko.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: The other club members have been supporting me and cheering me on so that the live show will be a huge hit.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: They'll all be on stage with me, too. I'll be alone but not really alone. That's what it feels like to me.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Alone but not really alone?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: That's right. And I feel like you'll be there, too.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Me? Why?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Because you came to talk to me today.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Well, that's because... I know you have a tendency to work too hard. As the student council president, I thought I should make sure you were okay.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: *Giggle* That's fine. Maybe I'm just reading too much into things.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: What about you, Shioriko? Did you realize anything after joining our school idol practices?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I... Just as before, I still believe being a school idol is a waste of time. However...

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: However?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I think I have a better understanding of why you were all so desperate to save your club.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I also understand why the other clubs want to do things that I find useless. Just a little, though.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I see. I'm glad you had some fun during our practices.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I wouldn't go that far. And I still do think it is a waste of time.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I still believe that your time could be better spent on something more valuable.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: However, I may have been wrong to dismiss every part of your activities as worthless. That is all.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: You're so nice, Shioriko.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Um, how in the world did you come to that conclusion?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: It just came to me while we were talking.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I am not nice. I just do not want people to make the wrong choices.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: *Giggle*

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Why are you laughing?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Oh, it's nothing. There's just something reassuring about having you here.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Reassuring? Why is that?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Because you've been watching over us.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: When we're unsure about what path we should take, you give us advice. When we get lost, you help us find our way again.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: When we head down the wrong path, you call us back on track. Knowing all that just feels really reassuring.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I bet everyone else feels the same way, too.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I don't know. I think everyone else sees me as a nuisance.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Maybe sometimes, but I don't think that's the only thing that people think. Everyone can see how earnest you are.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I do think you could have a little more faith in everyone, though.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Have more faith?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Yes. You said this earlier...

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Something may seem like a waste of time, but that doesn't mean everything about it is useless. I think a lot of things in life are like that.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: So I think you can step back and watch over people from a distance a bit more.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I will think about it.
